title: Information Literacy (IL) Diagnosis and Simulation-Based Customized Training Module for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic information retrieval and evaluation competencies
context.additional_context: A process where pre-service and in-service teachers diagnose information utilization skills required in actual educational settings and perform case-based training in simulated environments

learning_goals: Learners reduce the gap between self-assessment and actual test scores by over 30% in six IL (Information Literacy) domains, including information retrieval, evaluation, and ethical use.
Learners solve information utilization problems in real educational contexts through VR simulations with over 85% accuracy.
Learners identify at least three IL weaknesses and develop improvement plans based on personalized feedback reports.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
